Legal_Issue: Delay in filing refugee claim and credibility of fear
Credibility_Assessment: Delay undermined credibility; inconsistent conduct with claimed fear
Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by the New People's Army in the Philippines
Evaluation_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution or risk to life
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Unexplained delay in filing claim and continued visa renewals
Application_Error: Failure to promptly apply for refugee status without reasonable explanation
Application_Factor: Timing of application, consistency of conduct with claimed fear
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board erred in dismissing claims due to delay and lack of credible fear
Cause_of_Refusal: Significant delay without credible explanation, inconsistency with ongoing fear
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 96 and 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistency between claimed fear and actions (visa renewals)
Credibility_Issues: Claimants' explanation for delay found not credible
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that delay was due to waiting for situation in Philippines to improve
Omission_Type: Failure to file claim without undue delay
